title: Standings UX/UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished on-boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Standings tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* TV icon
* Audio icon (iOS only)
* Class picker (Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A, Class A Short Season, Rookie)
* League Filter
* Standings Data (based on the selected class and league filter)
* Foot Notes

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Standings tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the navigation bar complete and neat (no typographical errors, no overlapping and/or missing icons/texts)

THEN the wait time for the page to load will not be longer than 5 secs

THEN the user will be able to scroll through the page smoothly 

THEN the app will display the content of that tab in a scale to fit manner (the user will not be able to pinch in/out of the web views)

THEN the users will be able to click on buttons/elements and these will work

title: TV Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Standings Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the TV icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Class picker
* Date (Day Month Date)
* Arrows to navigate through the date (next/previous date)
* Video list (if available depending on the selected date)
* Done button

title: Audio Icon (iOS only)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Standings tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Audio icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the Gameday Audio page

THEN the app will not use any third-party application to open this

title: Standings Data
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished on-boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Standings tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the Standings with the following information:

* Team Name
* W
* L
* PCT
* GB
* L10
* STRK
* Foot Notes

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Standings tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the data in the app (can either be native or webview)

THEN the app will not open a third-party app or browser

title: Triple-A
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to Standings tab

GIVEN that the user tapped on "Triple-A" class

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "International"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the data in the following divisions:

* INT North
* INT South
* INT West

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Pacific Coast"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the data in the following divisions:

* PCL Amer. Northern
* PCL Amer. Southern
* PCL Pacific Northern 
* PCL Pacific Southern 

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page

title: Double-A
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to Standings tab

GIVEN that the user tapped on "Double-A" class

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Eastern"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the data in following divisions:

* EAS Eastern
* EAS Western

THEN the app will display 1st Half and 2nd Half filter buttons

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Southern"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the data in following divisions:

* SOU North
* SOU South

THEN the app will display 1st Half and 2nd Half filter buttons

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Texas"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the data in following divisions:

* TEX North
* TEX South

THEN the app will display 1st Half and 2nd Half filter buttons

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "1st Half"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will update the Standings page and will display the 1st Half data

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "2nd Half"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will update the Standings page and will display the 2nd Half data

THEN the app will display the Foot Notes at the bottom of the page
